title: Learning is Nonlinear
description: Interactive visualization comparing linear (sequential) and nonlinear (concept dependency) learning pathways using 40 calculus topics. Demonstrates how knowledge forms a dependency graph rather than a simple linear sequence.
subject: Educational Technology, Learning Theory, Graph Theory, Calculus
creator: Claude AI Skills - vis-network MicroSim Generator
prerequisites: Basic familiarity with calculus topics (helpful but not required)
learningObjectives: Understand the difference between linear and nonlinear learning pathways
Analyze how concept dependencies create a learning graph structure
Evaluate the limitations of sequential, textbook-style learning
Apply this understanding to personal study strategies

radioButtons.name: Linear Learning
radioButtons.description: Displays topics in sequential, serpentine pattern from top to bottom, showing traditional textbook progression

radioButtons.name: Nonlinear Learning
radioButtons.description: Displays force-directed graph showing actual concept dependencies with Limits pinned to the left as foundational concept

interactions: Click and drag nodes in nonlinear mode to explore relationships
Zoom in/out using mouse wheel or pinch gesture
Pan view by clicking and dragging background

coverage: Calculus I and II curriculum (40 topics from Limits through Series)
